overview.heading: What is Vagrant?
overview.body: Vagrant is the command line utility for managing the lifecycle of virtual machines. Isolate dependencies and their configuration within a single disposable and consistent environment.

get_started.heading: Getting Started
get_started.body: Use Vagrant to create and configure a reproducible and portable work environment.

cards.heading: Boxes
cards.body: The package format for Vagrant environments - create your own or use one from the public catalog.

cards.heading: Install and Specify a Box
cards.body: Use a base image to quickly clone a virtual machine.

cards.heading: Vagrantfile
cards.body: Describe your virtual machine's configuration and how to provision it.

cards.heading: Create a Vagrantfile
cards.body: Begin your Vagrant project by creating a Vagrantfile.

cards.heading: vagrant up
cards.body: Create and configure your virtual machine with the single most important Vagrant CLI command.

cards.heading: Boot an Environment
cards.body: Start your virtual machine with vagrant up.

cards.heading: Synced Folders
cards.body: Sync files from your host machine to the guest machine.

cards.heading: Synchronize Your Files
cards.body: Vagrant automatically syncs files to and from the guest machine allowing you to edits files locally and run them in your virtual machine.

cards.heading: Networking
cards.body: Access your virtual machines through the high-level networking set up by Vagrant.

cards.heading: Configure Your Network
cards.body: Forward network traffic from your local machine to your virtual guest machine running on Vagrant.

cards.heading: Plugins
cards.body: Add additional functionality to Vagrant via plugins.

cards.heading: Providers
cards.body: Manage other types of machines via providers.

cards.heading: Triggers
cards.body: Execute commands on your system before or after Vagrant operations.

cards.heading: Vagrant Share
cards.body: Share your Vagrant environment with anyone via a single command.

cards.heading: The Nomad Autoscaler
cards.body: Try out the autoscaling feature of HashiCorp Nomad in a Vagrant environment.

cards.heading: Data Encryption in Vault
cards.body: Try out data encryption in a Java application with HashiCorp Vault in a Vagrant environment.
